title: Slicing
text: You can return a range of characters by using the slice syntax.

Specify the start index and the end index, separated by a colon, to return a 
part of the string.

Example
Get the characters from position 2 to position 5 (not included):

b = "Hello, World!"
  print(b[2:5])

Try it Yourself »
Note: The first character has index 0.

title: Slice From the Start
text: By leaving out the start index, the range will start at the first character:

Example
Get the characters from the start to position 5 (not included):

b = "Hello, World!"
  print(b[:5])

Try it Yourself »

title: Slice To the End
text: By leaving out the end index, the range will go to the end:

Example
Get the characters from position 2, and all the way to the end:

b = "Hello, World!"
  print(b[2:])

Try it Yourself »

title: Negative Indexing
text:
Example
Get the characters:
From: "o" in "World!" (position -5)
To, but not included: "d" in "World!" (position -2):

b = "Hello, World!"
  print(b[-5:-2])

Try it Yourself »
